meanings.definition: To plench: to shrink back or flinch
meanings.sent1: She plenches whenever she hears a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: The cat plenched when the door slammed shut.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected sound made her plench comically.
meanings.sent4: His confidence plenched like a deflating balloon.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's plench was visible in her wide eyes.

meanings.definition: Plench: a sudden movement or flinch
meanings.sent1: His plench caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent2: The sudden noise caused a plench in the audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat's plench was so quick it looked like a dance move.
meanings.sent4: The plench of the rabbit was like a lightning strike.
meanings.sent5: The plench of the child was a reflexive response to the loud bang.

meanings.definition: Plench: to draw back or recoil in fear or surprise
meanings.sent1: She plenches away from spiders in fear.
meanings.sent2: The horse plenched at the sight of the snake.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected prank made him plench dramatically.
meanings.sent4: His heart plenched with fear as he heard the growl.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's body plenched instinctively at the sound of gunfire.
